titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Harold T. Rib aerial photograph collection, 1930-1980
titlestmt.subtitle: Harold T. Rib aerial photograph C0236
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Kerry Mitchell

publicationstmt.publisher: George Mason University. Libraries. Special Collections Research Center

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-04-16T08:39-0400

change.item: Converted to schema conforming EAD by dtd2schema.vh.xsl.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Harold T. Rib aerial photograph collection

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Libraries. Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: 31 boxes of aerial black and white photographs taken between the 1930s - 1979 of areas around the world, including the United States, Canada, Algeria, and Japan. Includes unprocessed oversize aerial photos.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Aerial black and white photographs of various cities and towns in the United States as well Canada, Algeria, and Japan. Many of the photographs came from the private collection of Harold T. Rib, a professor and former chief of aerial surveys for the Bureau of Public Roads and the Federal Highway Administration. Includes unprocessed oversize aerial photos.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Donated by the George Mason University Department of Geography and GeoInformation Science in 2013.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: There are no restrictions on personal use. Permission to publish material from the Harold T. Rib aerial photograph Collection must be obtained from Special Collections Research Center, George Mason University Libraries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Photographs are arranged alphabetically by country. Within each country folders are arranged alphabetically by state or province. Oversize photos are not currently arranged.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processing completed by Kerry Mitchell in 2014. Finding updated by Amanda Brent in July 2018.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Harold T. Rib aerial photograph collection, C0236, Special Collections Research Center, George Mason University Libraries.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Aerial photography dates back to the 19th century and refers to photographs taken from an elevated position, usually in an aircraft. Geographical surveys are among the most common uses for these photographs.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: This collection was originally created by Harold T. Rib, who donated it to the George Mason University Department of Geography and GeoInformation Science.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Special Collections Research center also holds the
